results.definition: recall knowledge from memory; have a recollection

examples: The ambassador was recalled to his country

results.definition: the process of remembering (especially the process of recovering information by mental effort)
examples: he has total recall of the episode

results.definition: a request by the manufacturer of a defective product to return the product (as for replacement or repair)
a bugle call that signals troops to return
cause one's (or someone else's) thoughts or attention to return from a reverie or digression
examples: She was recalled by a loud laugh

results.definition: make unavailable; bar from sale or distribution
examples: The company recalled the product when it was found to be faulty

results.definition: the act of removing an official by petition
